name: safer-route
title: safer-route
description: Switch to HTTPS scheme where support is detected
author: Brett Zamir

preferences.name: historyChecking
preferences.title: HTTPS History checking
preferences.description: Do you wish, as is recommended, to check the history for equivalent HTTPS support (and if found, to redirect to the HTTPS page)?

preferences.name: headRequest
preferences.title: HEAD Request Checks
preferences.description: If no HTTPS pages are found for the site (because you have opted not to check the history or because none were found for the site in the history), send an HTTPS HEAD request to determine whether an equivalent HTTPS page exists at the site, and if so, redirect to the HTTPS page (WARNING: agreeing to this will slow down your browser for every plain HTTP request made and will lock up your browser until the server returns a request!)

preferences.name: httpInHistory

options.label: Delete any equivalent HTTP files from history upon discovery

preferences.title: HTTP History Alteration
preferences.description: If HTTPS support is found for a site, do you also wish to delete any equivalent HTTP pages that are present in the history? (This will ensure that only the HTTPS version of the page will show in your location bar auto-complete and can thereby avoid the need for future redirection.)

preferences.name: paranoiaMode

options.label: If no HTTPS pages are found for the site, load the requested HTTP page
If no HTTPS pages are found for the site, load an empty tab in place of the HTTP page
Do not determine whether an HTTPS page exists; always attempt to load the HTTPS version

preferences.title: Paranoia Mode
preferences.description: Avoid loading HTTP pages? (Yes, we are talking about EVERY HTTP page, so be careful in changing from the default!)
